laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persisted undetectable levels during hypoglycemic episodes
Resumed normal peaks by 8 months after glucocorticoid replacement, discontinued at that time
Continued to be low during episodes of hypoglycemia
Restarted after low response in stimulation tests, peaks were normal at 3 years

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient 1: 28 µmol/liter; Patient 2: 38 µmol/liter; normal, 0–14 µmol/liter
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Mild hyperbilirubinemia persisted at discharge for both patients

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient 1: ALT 64 U/liter (normal up to 54 U/liter); AST normal; Patient 2: ALT 53 U/liter; AST 20 U/liter (normal for age)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement noted after treatment; not completely normal at discharge
